a.span: Board of Education Meeting - Public Participation Form

h3.strong: The NMPED has announced all New Mexico schools to be closed for the remainder of the school year.

New Mexico public education will shift to a learn-at-home model as schools remain closed for the rest of the academic year, Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham and state education and child care officials announced Friday.

strong.a: Click here to view Press Release.

span.strong: regarding this development as we get more information. For questions please contact the superintendent at kcowan@bps.k12.nm.us

p.span: Breakfast and Lunch will be served as a Grab And Go feature at all school sites and Rotary park, Acoma Pueblo, Santa Ana Wellness Center, Pena Blanca Community Church, San Felipe library, Santo Domingo Community Center, and Cochiti Haah Center. Hours have been extended from 9:00AM - 10:30AM. Students must be present to receive meals.

div.h1: BPS Launches Brand New YouTube Channel to Provide Resources!

img.alt: New Mexican Books to Read While Self-Isolated

a.span: New Mexican Books to Read While Self-Isolated

div.p: All of these books were published within the past few years, reflect the people who call New Mexico home, and are excellent reading and great for teaching. The list includes picture books, middle grade, young adult, horror, mysteries, fantasy, poetry, and nonfiction.

a.title: Go to comments for New Mexican Books to Read While Self-Isolated

img.alt: Guidance documents on continuous education during school building closures

a.span: Guidance documents on continuous education during school building closures

a.title: Go to comments for Guidance documents on continuous education during school building closures
Go to comments for Online Licensure
Go to comments for Continuous Learning Plan Support

div.p: Beginning Monday, April 6, APS @HOME, will begin broadcasting from 8 a.m. - Noon weekdays on Channel 5.1, and posting educational programs on the NMPBS YouTube channel.

a.title: Go to comments for At-Home learning for K-5 students
Go to comments for Special Education and Ancillary Support

img.alt: School Closure and Protocols. Friday, March 27, 2020

a.span: School Closure and Protocols. Friday, March 27, 2020

a.title: Go to comments for School Closure and Protocols. Friday, March 27, 2020

div.p: Do you have a worried or anxious kiddo? Try one of these fun calming activities. They are great for working through the worries and calming anxiety during stressful times

a.title: Go to comments for Superintendent's Spring STEM Challenge!

img.alt: Resources to understand the most recent Public Health Order.

a.span: Resources to understand the most recent Public Health Order.

div.p: Essential Businesses and Stay At Home FAQs

a.title: Go to comments for Resources to understand the most recent Public Health Order.

div.p: BPS is providing supplemental learning resources and opportunities for students during this time. We will be providing paper copies at all our Grab and Go meal sites this week, encouraging families, parents, and caregivers to find ways to keep students engaged in educational activities during this extended period of school closures.

a.title: Go to comments for Supplemental learning resources and opportunities

img.alt: AP Exam Updates for High School Students

a.span: AP Exam Updates for High School Students

div.p: For the 2019-20 exam administration only, students can take a 45-minute online exam at home.

a.title: Go to comments for AP Exam Updates for High School Students

div.p: Your child can utilize Istation at home. You can download the program here and log in like you would at school.

a.title: Go to comments for Istation at Home

img.alt: Financial and Behavioral Health Assistance for families

a.span: Financial and Behavioral Health Assistance for families

div.p: Information to help people in our communities who need assistance right now.

a.title: Go to comments for Financial and Behavioral Health Assistance for families

div.p: During this time away from school, BPS would like to provide you with ideas and websites containing activities you can do with your student. This is just a small list of links to educational websites.

a.title: Go to comments for FREE Technology Resources for Families
Go to comments for School Closure and Protocols
